tags.name: Introduction
tags.description:
Managing a Franchise System requires that all users have access to timely and reliable information that is appropriate for their role.. Yet, crucial information can be siloed in disparate applications limiting the ability to get a complete view across the entire franchise, reducing the efficiency of users performing their daily tasks. Getting a collection of enterprise applications to effectively work together can tie-up the IT resources needed to develop and maintain an integrated solution or perhaps is outside the core capabilities of the organization. To help meet this need while addressing the challenge, FranConnect offers several options for integrating FranConnect Sky with other business software.

Off-the Shelf Integrations

A number of popular third-party business applications are available for integration with your FranConnect Sky system. Using FranConnect-provided, pre-built integrations provide additional functionality such as document e-signature, lead assessment, and brand reputation management.

FranConnect Delivered Integrations

Customers can also choose to have FranConnect deliver and maintain an integrated solution. Working with the customer to understand their work processes, the applications that need to be integrated, and the desired outcome, FranConnect can propose a solution that best meets the customer’s business requirements.

Customer Initiated Integrations

FranConnect makes available documented REST APIs for several FranConnect Sky application modules. Providing the greatest degree of control, customers can use these APIs to develop and support custom integrations using their own in-house or third-party development resources.

FranConnect APIs

FranConnect APIs enable users to import and/or export data between FranConnect Sky and third-party applications. APIs make HTTP calls using the standard HTTP POST method in "x-www-form-urlencoded" format. You must provide the input to the API as an XML string whereas the output can either be in XML or JSON format, depending on how you would like to receive the response in your application. Various operations can be performed with the API by appending (and, thereby, replacing) variables in the request URL. FranConnect APIs support the following operations: login, module, subModule, query, create, update, retrieve, delete, log, and logout.

To perform the create and/or update operations, you must pass the attributes for the specific record in an xmlString. To perform the retrieve and/or delete operations, you must specify the parameters and their values in the filterXML. Other parameters that are used to specify the request (such as module name and sub module name) must be appended in the request as URL parameters.

Getting Started

Contact the helpdesk team (helpdesk@franconnect.com) to get the Client ID, Client Secret, and redirect URI that are required to generate the access token.

Supported Modules

The FranConnect API provides access to all entities in the FranConnect system within the Finance (manage-finance), Sales (fs), Info Manager (fim), CRM (cm), and the Admin (admin) modules.

Rate Limits and Accounts

The FranConnect API does not impose any rate limit restrictions at present, but the users are expected to retrieve data after certain interval and retrieve only the deltas (wherever applicable) so as to not overload the system. Retrieving a large dataset might result in slowness and impede the overall system performance.

Concurrent Requests

The FranConnect API does not support concurrent requests and the requests must be made one at a time.

Testing

You can perform testing in your UAT environment and then move the code over to your production environment. In case you don’t have a UAT environment, you can request for one from your customer advocate or by sending an email to our HelpDesk team (helpdesk@franconnect.com). A temporary UAT environment can be provided to you, but there might be some cost associated with it.

Important! This document uses Postman as the GUI client for testing the FranConnect API. However, you can emulate the API using your preferred programming language.

tags.name: FAQ
tags.description:
Below is a list of general frequently asked questions posed by developers working with the FranConnect API. For additional API related questions, contact the helpdesk team (helpdesk@franconnect.com).

  1. Can the API pull multiple attributes for multiple stores in a single request?
    If attribute is a tab: No, the API cannot pull multiple tabs for multiple stores in a single request. It is possible to pull multiple stores but not multiple attributes in a single request. For multiple attributes, you must send multiple requests.
    If attribute is a field: Yes, the API can pull multiple fields for multiple stores in a single request for a single tab. And, in response, it will retrieve all the fields of that particular tab.
  2. Can the API send comma delimited location ID (multiple locations) in a single request? We are assuming Location ID is the internal Location reference ID and not the Franchisee ID displayed on Center Info.
    For create/update/delete operation: No, the API cannot send comma delimited location ID.
    For retrieve operation: Yes, the API can send comma delimited location ID
  3. Can the API query back from a custom field (Location Number)?
    Yes, the API can pull from any of the custom field, if it is exportable and searchable.
  4. Does the API support Unicode input?
    No, the API does not support Unicode inputs. It supports data input through UTF-8.
  5. Encountered the Error “HTTP 401 Status Code” while setting up OAuth 2.0 Authentication.
    Ensure that you are using the correct Client ID and Client Secret pair provided by the FranConnect for setting up OAuth 2.0 Authentication.
  6. Encountered the Error “HTTP 404 Status Code” with the message “Not Found” while performing Retrieve operation such as Retrieve Schema, Retrieve CRM Leads or Retrieve the List of Modules through the API.
    Ensure that you are using the correct context path in the request URL as per your Tenant. This document uses the context paths (https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc/) and (https://skyapi.franconnect.net/) for the REST API and Finance API respectively.
  7. Encountered the Error “HTTP 400 Status Code” with the message “Invalid: access_token” while performing CRUD operation.
    Ensure that you have followed all the steps mentioned in the Authentication section to generate the access token. Enter the access token in the header of the request with Authorization as the key and its value in the format Bearer access_token.
    Temporary Headers also display the key Authorization, but didn't get updated always. So, it is recommended to add this key in the header of the request.
  8. How to add a new Remark and retrieve an existing Remark for a CRM contact through the API?
    Remark is a sub-module of CRM, that can be retrieved by using the “sub-module” endpoint. Click here for details on the “List of Sub-Modules” section.

    Follow these steps to create a new remark:
    Step1: Perform the Query operation by using “module” as “cm”, “sub-module” as “remark” and “operation” as “create”.

    This provides the “xmlString” that is required to create the Remark for that Contact. Click here for details on the Query operation.
    Step2: Perform the Create operation by using the xmlString received through Step 1, module as “cm” and “sub-module as “remark”.

    This creates a Remark for the Contact whose Reference ID is provided in the “xmlString”. Click here for details on the Create operation.
    Follow these steps to retrieve an existing remark for a contact:
    Step1: Perform the Query operation by using “module” as “cm”, “sub-module” as “remark” and “operation” as “retrieve”.
    This provides the “filterXML” that contains the attribute names and their values that are required to retrieve the Remarks available for that Contact. Click here for details on the Query operation.
    Step2: Perform the Retrieve operation by using any field retrieved using the filterXML, module as “cm” and “sub-module as “remark”.

    This retrieves all the Remarks for that Contact whose Reference ID is provided in the “filterXML”. Click here for details on the Retrieve operation.
  9. Encountered the Error “HTTP 404 Status Code” when an API Endpoint is hit.
    Ensure that there is only one forward slash '/' in the Endpoint. The Endpoint must be in this way: /rest/dataservices/operation. If you enter double forward slash '//' in the Endpoint, then the error 404 is displayed.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
FranConnect recommends you to use OAuth 2.0 authorization to authenticate to the FranConnect API.

Perform the following steps to set up the OAuth 2.0 authorization, using the Postman GUI client:

  1. Select GET as the API method.
  2. Click the Authorization tab. 
  3. Select the option OAuth 2.0 for the Type field.
  4. Select the option Request Headers for the Add authorization data to field.
  5. Click Get New Access Token to generate request for a new token.
  6. In the Get New Access Token dialog that appears, enter the details as explained in the following steps.
    1. Enter a name for your Access Token (Optional).
    2. Select the desired grant type. The FranConnect API supports four grant types using the OAuth framework. The fields in the Get New Access Token dialog vary depending upon your selection of the grant type. These are explained in detail in the Authorization Code, Implicit, Password-Credentials, and Client-Credentials sections.

tags.name: Authorization Code
tags.description:
For using the grant type as Authorization Code, enter the details in the Get New Access Token dialog as explained in the following steps:

  1. Enter a name for your Access Token (Optional).
  2. Select the Grant Type as Authorization Code.
  3. Enter the callback URL to which the generated access token would be redirected. The callback URL is also known as redirect URI and this URL should match the one that you use during the application registration process.
    Example: Callback URL can be https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html
    To register your callback/redirect URL, contact helpdesk@franconnect.com
    4. Note: The above mentioned example uses the callback URL using the Postman client. If you are using any other GUI client, use your own redirect URI.
  4. Enter the endpoint for the authorization server as the Auth URL. This is used to get the authorization code.
    Example: Auth URL can be https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=FRANC0NN3CT_API&redirect_uri=https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html

    5. Note: The response_type is code for the Grant Type Authorization and the redirect URI is same as the callback URL.

  5. Enter the endpoint for the authentication server in the Access Token URL field. This is used to exchange the authorization code for an access token.
    Example: Access Token URL can be https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/token?X-TenantID=developers.franconnectdemo.net&grant_type=authorization_code&client_id=FRANC0NN3CT_API&redirect_uri=https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html

    Note: If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the X-TenantID will be developers.franconnectdemo.net

  6. Enter the Client ID provided to you by FranConnect in the Client ID field.
    Example: Client ID can be FRANC0NN3CT_API
  7. Enter the Client Secret provided to you by FranConnect in the Client Secret field.
    Example: Client Secret can be DDEEMVOE2L0O1P9E
    Contact helpdesk@franconnect.com to get your Client ID and Client Secret.
  8. Select the option Send as Basic Auth header for the Client Authentication field.

Enter all these details, and click Request Token to request for a token.

The FranConnect API validates all the details and displays a dialog to enter the following additional information: Company Code, Username and Password.

  1. If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the company code will be developers.franconnectdemo.net
  2. Your username and password will be your login credentials for your FranConnect system

If all the details are valid, then, the access token is generated that can be used for the API calls.

Note: The access token is valid for 12 hours, after which a new access token is to be generated using the refresh token. This refresh token is valid for 30 days. Refresh tokens that were generated more than 30 days back cannot be used to generate a new access token.

tags.name: Implicit
tags.description:
For using the grant type as Implicit, enter the details in the Get New Access Token dialog as explained in the following steps:

  1. Enter a name for your Access Token (Optional).
  2. Select the Grant Type as Implicit.
  3. Enter the callback URL that you want to be redirected to, once your application is authorized. The callback URL is also known as redirect URI. This URL should match the one that you use during the application registration process.
    Example: Callback URL can be https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html
    To register your callback/redirect URL, contact helpdesk@franconnect.com
  4. Enter the endpoint for the authorization server as the Auth URL. This is used to get the authorization code.
    Note that the redirect URI is same as the callback URL.
    Example: Auth URL can be https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/authorize?response_type=token&client_id=FRANC0NN3CT_API&redirect_uri=https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html

    5. Note: The response_type is token for the grant type Authorization.

  5. Enter the Client ID provided to you by FranConnect in the Client ID field.
    Example: Client ID can be FRANC0NN3CT_API
  6. Select the option Send as Basic Auth header for the Client Authentication field.

The FranConnect API validates all the details and displays a dialog to enter the following additional information: Company Code, Username and Password.

  1. If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the company code will be developers.franconnectdemo.net
  2. Your username and password will be your login credentials for your FranConnect system

If all the details are valid, then, the access token is generated that can be used for the API calls.

Note: For this grant type, no refresh token is generated. The access token is valid for 12 hours, after which a new access token is to be generated.

tags.name: Password Credentials
tags.description:
For using the grant type as Password Credentials, enter the details in the Get New Access Token dialog as explained in the following steps:

  1. Enter a name for your Access Token (Optional).
  2. Select the Grant Type as Password Credentials.
  3. Enter the endpoint for the authentication server in the Access Token URL field. This is used to exchange the authorization code for an access token.
    Example: Access Token URL can be https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/token?X-TenantID=developers.franconnectdemo.net

    Note: If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the X-TenantID will be developers.franconnectdemo.net

  4. Enter the login credentials for your FranConnect system in the Username and Password fields.
  5. Enter the Client ID provided to you by FranConnect in the Client ID field.
    Example: Client ID can be FRANC0NN3CT_API
  6. Enter the Client Secret provided to you by FranConnect in the Client Secret field.
    Example: Client Secret can be DDEEMVOE2L0O1P9E
    Contact helpdesk@franconnect.com to get your Client ID and Client Secret
  7. Select the option Send as Basic Auth header for the Client Authentication field.

Enter all these details, and click Request Token to request for a token.

The FranConnect API validates all the details and generates an access token that can be used for the API calls.

Note: The access token is valid for 12 hours, after which a new access token is to be generated using the refresh token . This refresh token is valid for 30 days. Refresh tokens that were generated more than 30 days back cannot be used to generate a new access token.

tags.name: Client Credentials
tags.description:
For using the grant type as Client Credentials, enter the details in the Get New Access Token dialog as explained in the following steps:

  1. Enter a name for your Access Token (Optional).
  2. Select the Grant Type as Client Credentials.
  3. Enter the endpoint for the authentication server in the Access Token URL field. This is used to exchange the authorization code for an access token.
    Example: Access Token URL can be https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/token?X-TenantID=developers.franconnectdemo.net

    Note: If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the X-TenantID will be developers.franconnectdemo.net

  4. Enter the Client ID provided to you by FranConnect in the Client ID field.
    Example: Client ID can be FRANC0NN3CT_API
  5. Enter the Client Secret provided to you by FranConnect in the Client Secret field.
    Example: Client Secret can be DDEEMVOE2L0O1P9E
    Contact helpdesk@franconnect.com to get your Client ID and Client Secret
  6. Select the option Send as Basic Auth header for the Client Authentication field.

Enter all these details, and click Request Token to request for a token.

The FranConnect API validates all the details and generates an access token that can be used for the API calls.

Note: The access token is valid for 12 hours, after which a new access token is to be generated using the refresh token . This refresh token is valid for 30 days. Refresh tokens that were generated more than 30 days back cannot be used to generate a new access token.

tags.name: Refresh Token
tags.description: The access token that is generated using the grants enlisted above, remains valid only for 12 hours. Along with an access token, you'll also be given a refresh token. You can use this refresh token to generate a new access token. The lifespan of a refresh token is 30 days and once you've used up a refresh token, it can not be used to generate any more access tokens.

tags.name: Error Codes
tags.description:
FranConnect uses various error codes in the API response to indicate that the request was not processed. In general, response codes in the 2xx range indicate success while codes in the 4xx and 5xx range indicate an error in processing the request (such as a required parameter was invalid, incorrect XML format, and so on).

Following are the common error codes and their meaning for the FranConnect API:

  • 400 Invalid : <parameter> - Returned when the input parameter name is invalid

  • 400 Invalid XML format: {error} - Returned when the xmlString entered in the payload is invalid

  • 400 Request to {operation}{subModule} is not supported - Returned when some operation is restricted for a specific sub-module

  • 400 Invalid mandatory field : {field} - Returned when the value provided in xmlString is invalid for a mandatory field

  • 400 Invalid mandatory field : {custom_error} - Returned when the xmlString entered in the payload is invalid. For example, the end date is before the start date or the userID contains space(s)

  • 401 Missing : <parameter> - Returned when a mandatory parameter is missing

  • 401 mandatory field : {field} - Returned when a mandatory field is missing in the xmlString.

  • 409 {subModule}already exists - Returned when you try to perform create operation for a sub-module again and only one time submission is allowed for that sub-module

  • 411 Duplicate mandatory field : {field} - Returned when you try to input duplicate data

  • 438 Invalid tag <tagName> - Returned when the <tagName> is invalid for the specified module and sub-module

  • 500 Database error - Returned when there is a database mapping issue

  • 503 Service Unavailable - Returned when the system is undergoing maintenance

tags.name: List of Modules
tags.description:
You must use the "module" endpoint to get a list of all the modules that are available through the REST API.

To retrieve the list of modules, you must make a POST request with “responseType” parameter appended in the URL.

tags.name: List of Sub-Modules
tags.description:
You must use the "subModule" endpoint to get a list of all sub-modules/tabs available for a specific module and use them, subsequently, in Create, Retrieve, Update, and, Delete operations.

To retrieve the list of subModules for a given module, you must make a POST request with “module name”, and “responseType” parameters appended in the URL. The following sections provide examples on how this is to be performed for Admin (module=admin), Sales (module=fs), Info Manager (module=fim), and CRM (module=cm).

tags.name: List of Field Names
tags.description:
The "query" endpoint enables you to get all those field names and internal names that you need to send in the request body for Create, Retrieve, Update, and, Delete operations. You must use the "query" endpoint to generate an XML input sample. This XML sample must be used for manipulating various FranConnect system entities using the Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations. Sample XML will adapt to contain the fields as per the form builder.

You must consider the following points before using the "query" endpoint:

  • Once you have the access token, then only you are authorized to make a call to the "query" endpoint using this access token.
  • Request XMLs are generated after using this endpoint. You can use these Request XMLs to import/export/delete data into the FranConnect system. The 'module'represents the entity for which you want to retrieve the query xml string (for example, 'admin'for Admin, 'cm' for CRM, 'fs' for Sales, 'fim' for Info Manager. The subModule represents the sub-module/tab that is required (for example, 'user' for Users, 'contact' for contacts, 'lead' for leads, and, 'franchisee' for locations).
  • The 'roleTypeForQuery' parameter specifies the user type(for example, set roleTypeForQuery = 0 for franchise users, 1 for corporate users, 2 for regional users, and so on) that you want to create or update. However, for delete and retrieve operations, the 'roleTypeForQuery' parameter is not required.
  • The response is received in XML format only.
  • If internationalization (translation settings) is enabled, then the <userLanguage> element node appears in "query" endpoint for the create and update operations. Otherwise, your system's default language is considered as the default language for the API.

tags.name: Admin
tags.description:
The Admin module enables you to manage different types of users and locations. Using the FranConnect API, you can perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations for various types of users (such as Corporate User, Regional User, Franchisee User, and Divisional User) and locations.

The following sections explain and provide examples to perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations for users. Similarly, you can perform Create, Retrieve, and Update operations for locations.

tags.name: Sales
tags.description:
The Sales Module helps you to manage franchisee leads across their lifecycle. Using the FranConnect API, you can perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations for all the tabs that are available in Sales > Lead Management, except the file type fields and the pages/tabs that contain multiple tabular sections. The “file” type of fields are not supported by the FranConnect API and you can perform only Retrieve operations on pages that contain multiple tabular sections.

The following sections provide details and examples to perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations on a Sales Lead’s “Primary Info” tab. Similarly, you can perform these operations for any other tab in Sales > Lead Management.

tags.name: Info Manager
tags.description:
Using the FranConnect API, you can manage the "in-development" and the operational locations in the Info Manager module. Using Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete API operations, you can manage information that can either be in the location’s main page (in Center Info) or in any of the tabs (such as Real Estate and Mystery Review).

Note that the following sections explain and provide examples on how to perform these operations on the “Primary Info” tab for locations. Similarly, you can perform these operations for other tabs as well for locations that are either in-development or have been opened since.

tags.name: CRM
tags.description: The CRM module is used to manage leads, contacts, and accounts across their entire lifecycle. Using Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete API operations, you can manage information that can either be in the CRM’s main page or in any of the tabs (such as Accounts, Leads, Contacts, and Opportunities).

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: A task is a piece of work to be done. Using the FranConnect API, you can perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and, Delete operations for the tasks in Sales, Info Manager and CRM modules.

tags.name: Emails
tags.description: An email is a piece of communication that is sent from within the FranConnect system. Using the FranConnect API, you can perform the Create, Retrieve and Delete operations for emails. Note that the Update operation cannot be performed for emails since an email that has already been created and sent out cannot be updated.

tags.name: SMS
tags.description:
Using the FranConnect API, you can perform the Retrieve operation for SMS for only the Sales and CRM modules, as follows: CRM-Contacts and CRM-Leads, Sales-Leads

>

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: Using the FranConnect API, you can perform the Retrieve operation for Campaigns for only the Sales and CRM modules, as follows: CRM-Contacts and CRM-Leads, Sales-Leads.

tags.name: Email Campaigns
tags.description: Using the FranConnect API, you can perform the Retrieve operation for Campaign emails for only the Sales and CRM modules, as follows: CRM-Contacts and CRM-Leads, Sales-Leads.

tags.name: SMS Campaigns
tags.description: Using the FranConnect API, you can perform the Retrieve operation for Campaign SMS as follows: CRM Contacts and CRM Leads, Sales Leads.

tags.name: Finance
tags.description: The Finance module supports integration with other third party systems for reporting on sales, royalties, profit and loss, and payments. The FranConnect API allows you to automate the transfer of data between the Finance module and your Finance/POS systems.

tags.name: Franchisee Number
tags.description:
Franchisee number is the unique reference number that indicates a particular location. It is used while performing CRUD operations in the API. Using the FranConnect API, you can retrieve a list of franchisee numbers for all the locations or for a single location.

Note: For the Info Manager sub-module, the Franchisee number refers to the unique Reference ID for that franchisee location and can be used for the Update, Retrieve and the Delete operations.

tags.name: Sales Reports
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Sales based operations.

tags.name: Royalties
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Royalty based operations.

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Payment based operations.

tags.name: Adjustments
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Adjustment based operations.

tags.name: Profit and Loss Statements
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Profit and Loss based operations.

tags.name: Memos
tags.description: This API endpoint supports the Finance Memo based operations.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: The purpose of the Operations module is improve operational performance from the brand to the unit level. The FranConnect API allows you create Segment Hierarchies. [note: improve]

tags.name: Segments
tags.description: These API endpoints support operations associated with Segments.

tags.name: Events and Webhooks
tags.description:
Event is generated by the FranConnect Sky System when an action occurs or is completed. By Requesting Event, the System helps the users to know the recent activities or actions that have occurred.

Webhook Introduction

Webhook is a way through which an application can send automated messages or information to other applications over the web. It is a serialized message sent from one application to another’s unique URL. For example, an e-commerce site notifies you about the new orders, a payment site tells your accounting app when the clients pay you, etc.

In other words, using Webhook, the online accounts can “speak” to each other and get notified automatically when something new happens.

How Events and Webhooks are Related?

Event represents everything that happens in the System. Every new activity in the System comes under Event. On the other hand, Webhook is a mechanism that allows you to receive notifications about Event that you have created.

In short, Event is an action or activity, and Webhook is the notifications about that action or activity.

Why Enable Webhook?

The main reason to enable Webhook in the FranConnect Sky System is that continuously Polling a service to find out the recent activities is a cumbersome process. Polling is a waste of resources for the Client as well as the Server. Giving the Server the ability to push notifications via Webhook Callback resolves this problem effectively, as the notification is provided in the form of a Webhook URL after every recent activity. In fact, Webhook notifications provide information about Events when they occur.

Handling Webhook

To confirm that the notification sent via HTTP POST request has been successfully delivered, a status code 2XX reply from the Webhook Configured URL.

tags.name: Sales Webhook
tags.description: Use webhooks in workflows to pass information about a Lead from FranConnect to another web application.

tags.name: CRM Webhook
tags.description: Use webhooks in workflows to pass information about a Lead/Contact from FranConnect to another web application.

tags.name: INFO MANAGER WEBHOOK
tags.description: FranConnect System now supports Webhook to pass information from FranConnect’s Info Mgr to another web application about a location.

get.description:
Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/common/franchisee
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/common/franchisee

To retrieve the Franchisee Number, you must provide the following items in the header of the GET request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Specify “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. Specify “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Performing the above mentioned steps will provide the franchisee number and the franchisee names of all the locations.

post.description:
Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/common/franchisee/filter
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/common/franchisee/filter

To retrieve the Franchisee Number for a specific location, you must provide the following items in the header of the POST request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Specify “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. Specify “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

You can specify any of the following as the filter criteria in the body of the request: areas, countries, divisions, entities, fields, and franchisee numbers. Performing the above mentioned steps will provide the franchisee number and the franchisee name for the required location.

In the example that is included, the “franchisee_name” has been used as a ‘constraints’ criterion. Other acceptable values of constraints, that can be used to filter and retrieve franchisee number for a specific location, are explained in the following table:

This section provides details (as well as an example) for performing the Create operation to add a user in the FranConnect system. Note that it is important to specify the “userLevel”, as this would determine the type of user that would be created. For example, to create a corporate user, the “userLevel” must be “Corporate”. Similarly, for regional users, the “userLevel” must be “Regional” and for brand/divisional users, the “userLevel” must be “Divisional”. For franchisee users, the “userLevel” can either be an “Owner” or an “Employee”, depending on the type of franchisee user that is created.

Operation Name:POST

To perform a Create operation for adding a user using the FranConnect API, you must make a POST request on the request URL. The request URL comprises of the context path followed by the API endpoint mentioned above. The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/x-www-form-urlencoded“.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

  1. The module for which the Create operation is being performed. In this case, the module to be used is “admin”.

  2. The sub-module for which the Create operation is being performed. A list of all sub-modules can be retrieved from the “subModule” endpoint mentioned here. In this case, the subModule to be used is “user”.

Details on how the query operation is to be performed is mentioned here.

You can also perform a Query operation to retrieve the names of the fields that you would want to use as parameters in the filterXML. Click here for more details.

Retrieve Values using Pagination

Pagination is a process that is used to divide the potential result into records and retrieve the required records, one by one on demand. All retrieve operations using the FranConnect API support pagination, with the help of limit and offset parameters appended in the request URL.

An offset is simply the number of records that are skipped after which the response data is retrieved. For the FranConnect API, offset can have any positive value. By default, 0 is considered as the offset value.

Limit is the total number of records that are to be retrieved in one response. For the FranConnect API, limit can have a maximum value of 100.

To get a paginated response for your retrieve request, you must define how many records you want to retrieve, using the limit parameter, and from where would the records be starting from, using the offset parameter. For example, if your response dataset contains more than 100 records, you must use pagination as "offset=0&limit=100". For the next iteration, you must use pagination as "offset=100&limit=100". Note that the response data also contains a flag "hasMoreRecords=true" which indicates that there are more records remaining to be paginated.

Following is an example of the limit and offset parameters used for a Retrieve operation using the Sales sub-module. In a similar manner, these parameters can be applied to retrieve fields that are available during the Retrieve operation for the Admin, Info Manager and CRM sub-modules.

This section contains an example of the Create operation to add a CRM transaction through the CRM > Transactions module. Similarly, you can use the Create operation to add data to any of the tabs/ sub-modules in CRM > Transactions.

Operation Name:POST
API Endpoint:/rest/dataservices/create?module=cm&subModule=transaction&xmlString=requiredxmlString&responseType=XML

Prerequisites to perform a Create operation

To perform a Create operation for adding a transaction using the FranConnect API, you must make a POST request on the request URL. The request URL comprises of the context path followed by the API endpoint mentioned above. The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/x-www-form-urlencoded“.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

  1. The module for which the Create operation is being performed. In this case, the module to be used is “cm”.

  2. The sub-module for which the Create operation is being performed. A list of all sub-modules can be retrieved from the “subModule” endpoint mentioned here. In this case, the subModule to be used is “transaction”.

  3. Response type as XML or JSON, depending on the type of response that is desired. If this parameter is not provided, the default response type is XML.

  4. xmlString that would contain the attribute names and their values in the request that is to be used to add a CRM transaction. In order to determine the parameter names/ schema, a query operation is to be performed with the corresponding module and sub-module names and the operation as Create. Details on how the query operation is to be performed is mentioned here.

Performing the above mentioned steps would create a new CRM transaction. The response received from the API contains “referenceId” which represents the unique reference ID for that CRM transaction and can be used for the Update, Retrieve and the Delete operations.

For the Retrieve operation, you can also use pagination to chain through the records using the limit and offset parameters appended in the URL. Click here for more details.
Operation Name:POST
API Endpoint:/rest/dataservices/retrieve?module=cm&subModule=CampaignEmail&filterXML=filteredxmlString&responseType=XML

Prerequisites to perform a Retrieve operation

To perform a Retrieve operation for retrieving a Campaign email using the FranConnect API, you must make a POST request on the request URL. The request URL comprises of the context path followed by the API endpoint mentioned above.

The following items must be used in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/x-www-form-urlencoded“.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

  1. The module for which the Retrieve operation is being performed. In this case, the module to be used is “cm”.

  2. The sub-module for which the Retrieve operation is being performed. A list of all sub-modules can be retrieved from the “subModule” endpoint mentioned here. In this case, the subModule to be used is “CampaignEmail”.

  3. Response type as XML or JSON, depending on the type of response that is desired. If this parameter is not provided, the default response type is XML.

  4. filterXML that would contain the attribute names and their values in the request that is to be used to retrieve a Campaign email. In this case, "referenceId" has been used to retrieve the details of an existing Campaign email. In order to determine the parameter names/ schema, a query operation is to be performed with the corresponding module and sub-module names and the operation as Retrieve. Details on how the query operation is to be performed is mentioned here.

Note: Since the Retrieve operation is not being done on the main tab/sub-module, you are required to mention the Reference ID of the lead/contact/location for whom you will perform the API operation. You can also perform a Query operation to retrieve the schema that would be used to create data for that module-subModule combination. Click here for more details.

get.description:
The report period in Finance > Sales refers to that time duration for which sales is to be reported by the franchisees. The report period for each location is defined in the financial agreement that is associated with that location.

You must make a GET request to the request URL, along with other required details, to retrieve the report periods. This would provide a list of all the report periods for which sales is to be reported by the franchisees.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/periods/franchiseeNo/{id}
UAT API Endpoint: https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/periods/franchiseeNo/{id}
To retrieve the report periods for which sales data has not been entered for a particular franchisee location, you must make a GET request on the request URL.

The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

  • Franchisee number as the internal unique reference number of the location. Click here for details on retrieving the franchisee number.

    • Performing the above mentioned steps would return all the report periods for which sales has not been reported by that location.

Finance categories are an important part of the sales report. These represent the categories that are used to report Sales data. To retrieve all the finance categories, you must use the report period as input parameter for the GET request. Click here for details on retrieving these report periods.

Then, use this report period, and perform a GET request to retrieve a list of financial categories that are available to report the sales for the given report period.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/finance-categories/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/finance-categories/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}

The following items must be included in the header of the GET request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Non-Finance categories represent the categories that are not financial in nature but are still tracked as a part of sales reports (such as customer count and loyalty program enrollments). Every sales report has at least one non-finance category in it. To retrieve all the non-finance/Key Performance Indicator (KPI) categories that are used in sales report, you must use a report period and its corresponding finance categories as input parameters for the GET request. Click Report Periods for details on retrieving these report periods and click Finance Categories for details on retrieving these finance categories.

Then, using these parameters, perform a GET request to retrieve a list of non finance categories that are available to report the sales for the given report period.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/kpi-categories/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/kpi-categories/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}
The following items must be included in the header of the GET request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Note: Sometimes, you may not have non-finance categories set up in your sales report. If this is the case, you need not retrieve the non-finance categories.

There are some additional invoice items that can be included in the sales report apart from the finance and non-finance categories. To retrieve these additional invoice items, you must use a report period as input parameter for the GET request. Click Report Periods for details on retrieving these report periods.

Then, use this report period, and perform a GET operation to retrieve a list of additional invoice items that are available to report the sales for the given report period.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/addtional-line-items/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/categories/addtional-line-items/franchiseeNo/{franchisee_number}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}

The following items must be included in the header of the GET request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Note: Configuring the additional invoice items is optional. In case you have not configured these as part of your sales report and still if you try retrieving them using the above mentioned endpoint, an empty data set is retrieved.

You must make a GET request to the API endpoint, along with other required details, to retrieve the report status and their corresponding keys.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/status
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/status
The following items must be included in the header of the GET request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. Content-Type as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Following table lists the various status that can be attributed to sales reports and can therefore be used as a search constraint in retrieve operations.

Key

Name

P

Waiting for approval

A

Approved

R

Rejected

I

Invoiced

K

Waiting for Acknowledgement

Note: Configuring the additional invoice items is optional. In case you have not configured these as part of your sales report and still if you try retrieving them using the above mentioned endpoint, an empty data set is retrieved.

post.description:
Sales reports allow locations to declare their proceeds during that report period. These are comprised of finance and non-finance categories. Sometimes, the sales report may contain additional invoice items. A sales report can be created for a location for that time duration for which sales is to be reported by the franchisees. In order to do so, a POST type request is to be made to the specified endpoint.

Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Finance Categories, Non Finance Categories and Additional Line Items must be included in the body of the request.

Performing the above mentioned steps would create a new sales report. The response received from the API contains the “reportNo” and “salesReportID”. While the “reportNo” represents the "Report ID" of the report and can be seen in Finance > Sales > Sales Summary, the “salesReportID” represents the unique reference ID for that sales report.

You can retrieve an existing sales report by making a POST type request to the specified endpoint.

Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/sales/filter
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/sales/filter
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The constraints that would be used to filter out the sales report must be included in the body of the request. In the example that is included, the “salesreportID” has been used as a ‘constraints’ criterion. Other acceptable values of constraints, that can be used to filter and retrieve sales reports, are explained in the following table:

Note: The response includes the promissory note payment details only if the corresponding option is selected through the Admin module.

Field

 

Field Description

Applied Clause

 

Format

reportNo

Sales Report Number as seen in UI

EQUAL, IN

String

salesReportID

Internal Unique Reference Number of the Sales Report

EQUAL, IN

String

franchiseeNo

Internal Unique Reference Number of the location

EQUAL, IN

String

reportPeriodStart/End

Report Period Start/ End Date in YYYY-MM-DD format

EQUAL, GREATER_THAN,

LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL,

LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, BETWEEN

Date

reportSubmitDate

Report Submit Date in YYYY-MM-DD format

EQUAL, GREATER_THAN,

LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL,

LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, BETWEEN

Date

Total Sales

GREATER_THAN,

LESS_THAN

String

Report Status of the Sales Report

EQUAL, IN

String

reportType

Report Type of the Sales Report

EQUAL, IN

String

lastModifiedDate

Last Modified Date in YYYY-MM-DD format

EQUAL, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, BETWEEN

Date

put.description:

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

“salesReportID” which refers to the internal unique ID for the sales report. You can fetch this information by retrieving the sales report details on the basis of report number or any other constraint.

post.description:
Once a sales report is approved, the royalty for the same is automatically generated by the FranConnect system. Royalty reports are generated on the basis of sales submitted for the locations. The method for retrieving a Royalty report is similar to that of retrieving a Sales report. To retrieve a royalty report, a POST of request is to be made to the specified endpoint.

Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/royalties/filter
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/royalties/filter

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The constraints that would be used to filter out the royalty invoices must be included in the body of the request. The following table lists all the attributes that can be used as constraints while retrieving royalty reports along with the “clauses” that are supported for each constraint.

Field Display Name

Applicable Clauses

String

EQUAL, IN

String

EQUAL, GREATER_THAN,

Date

post.description:
You can create payments for a royalty by making a POST request to the Payments endpoint.

Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/payments
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/payments
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The franchiseeNo, dateReceived and royaltyType must be included in the body of the request. The collectionMethod field will change according to the opted collection method. Refer to the request body schema down below to understand what additional fields you must pass with different collection methods. If the Create operation is successful, performing the above mentioned steps would return a response containing the paymentNo and paymentID.

Using the FranConnect API, you can create payments by using the following types of royalties: Royalty, Advertisement, Promissory Notes, Late Fees, Additional Fees, Tax, and All.

You can create adjustments for a sales report by making a POST request to the Adjustments endpoint.

Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/adjustments
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/adjustments
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

SalesReportID, franchiseeNo and dateReceived must be included in the body of the request.

Performing the above mentioned steps would create a new sales report with Adjustments. The response received from the API contains the “reportNo” and “salesReportID”. While the “reportNo” represents the "Report ID" of the report and can be seen in Finance > Sales > Sales Summary, the “salesReportID” represents the unique reference ID for that sales report.

put.description:

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The following items must be used as path parameters:

“salesReportID” which refers to the internal unique ID for the sales report. You can fetch this information by retrieving the sales report details on the basis of report number or any other constraint.

Finance categories are an important part of the sales report. These represent the categories that are used to report Sales data. To retrieve all the finance categories of Sales Report for which adjustment has to be filled, you must use the franchisee ID and the Sales Report ID as input parameters for the GET request.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/finance-categories/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/finance-categories/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Performing the above mentioned steps would return a list of all the finance categories of Sales Report for which adjustment has been filled.

Non-Finance categories represent the categories that are not financial in nature but are still tracked as a part of sales reports (such as customer count and loyalty program enrollments). Every sales report has at least one non-finance category in it. To retrieve all the non-finance/Key Performance Indicator (KPI) categories that are used in sales report for which adjustment has to be filled, you must use the franchisee ID and the Sales Report ID as input parameters for the GET request.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/kpi-categories/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/kpi-categories/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Performing the above mentioned steps would return a list of all the non-finance categories of Sales Report for which adjustment has been filled.

There are some additional invoice items that can be included in the sales report apart from the finance and non-finance categories. To retrieve all the additional invoice items that are used in sales report for which adjustment has to be filled, you must use the franchisee ID and the Sales Report ID as input parameters for the GET request.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/addtional-line-items/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/adjustments/categories/addtional-line-items/franchisees/{franchiseeID}/sales/{salesReportID}
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Performing the above mentioned steps would return a list of all the Additional Line Items in the Sales Report for which adjustment has been filled.

get.description:
You can retrieve the Profit and Loss report periods for a location for that time duration for which sales is to be reported by the franchisees. In order to do so, a GET request is to be made to the specified endpoint.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/profit-loss/periods/franchiseeNo/{franchise_number}
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/profit-loss/periods/franchiseeNo/{franchise_number}
The following items must be included in the body of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The following must be used as path parameters:

  • Franchisee number as the internal unique reference number of the location. Click here for details on retrieving the franchisee number.

    • Performing the above mentioned steps would return a list of all the statement periods for which Profit and Loss statement has not been declared by that location.

You can retrieve the Profit and Loss categories that are present in the Profit and Loss statements for each franchisee against which income and expenses are to be entered. In order to do so, a GET request is to be made to the specified endpoint.

Operation Name:GET
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/profit-loss/categories
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/profit-loss/categories
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

Performing the above mentioned steps would return a response that contains all the profit and loss categories that are configured in the system and a placeholder where the amount can be entered against that corresponding category. You can use this information to add the profit and loss details while creating and/ or updating profit and loss reports.

post.description:

Operation Name:POST
Production API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnect.net/manage-finance/profit-loss
UAT API Endpoint:https://skyapi.franconnectuat.net/manage-finance/profit-loss
The following items must be included in the header of the request:

  1. "Authorization" as the key and its value in the format "Bearer access_token". This access_token is generated as a part of authentication. Click here for details on the steps to generate the access token.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The profit and loss categories must be included in the body of the request. Click here for details on retrieving the Profit and Loss categories.

If the Create operation is successful, performing the above mentioned steps would return a response containing the "plrepld". This represents the internal reference ID for the Profit and Loss statements that was just created and can be used for the update and the retrieve operations.

You can retrieve an existing Profit and Loss statement in the system by making a POST request to the specified endpoint.

  2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

The constraints that would be used to filter out the profit and loss report must be included in the body of the request. The following table details the other values that can be used as constraints along with their clause criteria:

Date in YYYY-

MM-DD format

The following items must be included in the body of the request:

Make a POST request to the specified endpoint to retrieve all segments according to your custom filter criteria.   2. “Content-Type” as the key and its value in the format “application/json”.

  3. “X-TenantId” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system’s URL. Click here for details on identifying the “X-TenantId”.

When defining contraints, you have the option of selecting from multiple clauses for a specific field. Following isa list of clauses, as how they look in the UI vs how they should be worded in your request body.
  • is = IEQUAL
  • is not = INOT_EQUAL
  • contains = ILIKE
  • does not contain = NOT_ILIKE
  • in = IN
  • not in = NOT_IN
  • on = ON
  • before = BEFORE
  • after = AFTER
  • is between = IS_BETWEEN
  • in last year = LAST_YEAR
  • in current year = CURRENT_YEAR
  • in last month = LAST_MONTH
  • in this month = THIS_MONTH

post.description:
To enable the Webhook feature, you can send an email to helpdesk@franconnect.com and share the webhook URL where the updates can be pushed in the JSON format. Once the feature is enabled, the Webhook URL must be configured for receiving Webhook notifications. Please read the following steps to configure your Webhook URL:

  1. Enter Workflow Name and select Workflow Type in the Sales > Workflows.
  2. Select when to Trigger the Workflow accordingly.
  3. Choose Workflow condition “Which Leads do you want to execute this workflow on?” – All Leads or Leads matching required condition(s). If selecting “All Leads”, then as the name suggests, the Workflow condition would apply to all the Leads. But, if selecting “Leads matching required condition(s)”, then select Fields to filter Leads from the drop-down list.
  4. Choose Action from the drop-down list, and select “Configure Webhook URL”.

  5. A pop-up “Configure Webhook URL” would display. Enter the valid Webhook URL, and click “Associate & Save”.


Receiving Webhook Notifications

FranConnect Sky System would send Webhook notifications via HTTP POST requests in the JSON Format to the URL endpoints that you defined to Retrieve Primary Info of a Lead in the Sales Module along with the Tenant ID. Tenant ID would be the name of the Tenant. An example of the dataset format is given on the right panel.

fsLead.otherLeadSourceDetail: You Have a New Lead from VeteransOpportunities.com

post.description:
To enable this feature, you can send an email to helpdesk@franconnect.com and share the webhook URL(an endpoint that can receive the array of JSON) where the updates can be pushed in the JSON format. Once the feature is enabled, if new data is added, updated, or deleted in any of the tabs (System and Custom), the event is captured. In just 5 minutes the information is pushed to the endpoint provided by you.


Furthermore, if multiple modifications are made within the given 5 minutes period across the franchise(s), you will receive the array of JSON. For example, a Guarantor is added, and an Employee is deleted in an ABC Franchise. An update is also performed on the Center Info details of the XYZ franchise in the same 5 minutes session. Then, all these events will get captured. The dataset format that you will receive for this example is given on the right-hand side

To enable the Webhook feature, you can send an email to helpdesk@franconnect.com and share the webhook URL where the updates can be pushed in the JSON format. Once the feature is enabled, the Webhook URL must be configured for receiving Webhook notifications. Please read the following steps to configure your Webhook URL:

  1. Enter Workflow Name and select Workflow Type along with Record Type in the CRM > Workflows. For this instance, we have selected Lead as the Record Type.
  2. Select when to Trigger the Workflow accordingly.
  3. Choose Workflow condition “Which Leads do you want to execute this workflow on?” – All Leads or Leads matching required condition(s). If selecting “All Leads”, then as the name suggests, the Workflow condition would apply to all the Leads. But, if selecting “Leads matching required condition(s)”, then select Fields to filter Leads from the drop-down list.
  4. Choose Action from the drop-down list, and select “Configure Webhook URL”.

  5. A pop-up “Configure Webhook URL” would display. Enter the valid Webhook URL, and click “Associate & Save”.


Receiving Webhook Notifications

FranConnect Sky System would send Webhook notifications via HTTP POST requests in the JSON Format to the URL endpoints that you defined to Retrieve Primary Info of a Lead or Contact in the CRM Module along with the Tenant ID. Tenant ID would be the name of the Tenant. An example of the dataset format is given on the right panel.

cmLead.serviceID: Product/Service Update, Newsletters, Announcements, Webinars and Events, Offers, Others, Send Email, Email Communications, Information Email

post.description:
Operation Name : POST
Production API Endpoint : https://auth.franconnect.net/userauth/oauth/token
UAT API Endpoint : https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/token

Perform the following steps to generate a new access token using a refresh token:

  1. Using the Postman GUI, select POST as the API method and enter https://auth.franconnectuat.net/userauth/oauth/token as the request url.

  2. Enter the following items as query parameters:

    • “grant_type” as the key and its value as “refresh_token”.

    • “refresh_token” as the key and its value will be the complete refresh token value that you have received from authentication.

  3. Click on Authorization tab and choose Basic Auth for the type field. Enter the Client ID provided to you by FranConnect in the username field, for e.g. FRANC0NN3CT_API. Enter the Client Secret provided to you by FranConnect in the password field, for e.g. DDEEMVOE2L0O1P9E.

    Contact helpdesk@franconnect.com to get your Client ID and Client Secret.

  4. Include the following item in the header of the request:

    • “X-TenantID” as the key and its value based on your FranConnect system's URL. If the login URL for your FranConnect system is https://developers.franconnectdemo.net/fc, then the X-TenantID will be developers.franconnectdemo.net.

  5. Click Send to get a new access token along with a new refresh token.
